Name: Electron (e⁻)
S_observable_Analysis: Stable lowest-energy charged lepton. Bounded properties. Observable.
Evidence: Stable 13.8Gy. Bounded charge ±e. Mass 0.511 MeV fixed.

Name: Electron Neutrino (νe)
S_observable_Analysis: Mass should be discrete eigenvalue. Oscillation = S_observable sampling.
Evidence: Neutrino oscillation observed - discrete sampling of flavor basis

Name: Muon (μ⁻)
Unbounded_Assumptions: WHY does it exist? 207× electron mass - arbitrary
S_observable_Analysis: 2nd generation = excited state of electron? Resonance not new particle?
Evidence: Decays to electron. Unstable (2.2μs). Why separate particle?

Name: Muon Neutrino (νμ)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Why separate from νe? Oscillates to other flavors
S_observable_Analysis: Flavor = sampling basis. All neutrinos = one particle different projections?
Evidence: Oscillation proves flavors mix. Not truly separate particles.

Name: Tau (τ⁻)
Unbounded_Assumptions: WHY does it exist? 3477× electron mass - arbitrary
S_observable_Analysis: 3rd generation = higher resonance? Even more unstable (2.9×10⁻¹³s)
Evidence: Very short-lived. Decays to lighter leptons. Why needed?

Name: Tau Neutrino (ντ)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Why 3 neutrino flavors? Oscillation mixes all
S_observable_Analysis: Same as νμ - flavor sampling artifact?
Evidence: Last neutrino discovered (2000). Oscillates like others.

Name: Up Quark (u)
S_observable_Analysis: Lightest quark. Bounded. But fractional charge = S_complete artifact?
Evidence: Never isolated. Only seen in hadrons with integer charge.

Name: Down Quark (d)
S_observable_Analysis: Second lightest. Confined. Fractional charge problematic.
Evidence: With u quark makes proton/neutron. Confinement = S_observable boundary.

Name: Charm Quark (c)
S_observable_Analysis: Like muon - excited u quark state? Resonance?
Evidence: Unstable. Decays to lighter quarks. Why separate?

Name: Strange Quark (s)
S_observable_Analysis: Like muon - excited d quark state?
Evidence: Unstable. "Strangeness" = just another quantum number.

Name: Top Quark (t)
Unbounded_Assumptions: WHY 3rd gen? 75000× up mass. Heaviest particle!
S_observable_Analysis: Highest resonance? 173 GeV = near electroweak scale
Evidence: Decays in 5×10⁻²⁵s. Barely exists. Why fundamental?

Name: Bottom Quark (b)
S_observable_Analysis: Like tau - 3rd resonance level?
Evidence: Unstable. Decays. Named "beauty" - aesthetic not physical.

Name: Photon (γ)
S_observable_Analysis: Discrete energy E=hν in S_observable. Field = S_complete.
Evidence: Planck's quantization. Photons counted discretely.

Name: Gluon (g)
Unbounded_Assumptions: 8 gluons from SU(3) - why this structure?
S_observable_Analysis: Confinement = S_observable boundary. 8 may reduce in bounded theory.
Evidence: Never isolated. Confinement already noted as S_observable effect.

Name: W Boson (W±)
S_observable_Analysis: Why 80.4 GeV? Arbitrary from continuous Higgs VEV.
Evidence: Heavy but observed. Mass should be discrete not continuous.

Name: Z Boson (Z⁰)
S_observable_Analysis: Why 91.2 GeV? Arbitrary from continuous VEV.
Evidence: Observed at LEP. Mediates neutral current. Mass arbitrary?

Name: Higgs Boson (H)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Continuous scalar field; infinite vacuum; hierarchy problem
S_observable_Analysis: Higgs mechanism = S_complete construction? VEV should be discrete.
Evidence: 125 GeV observed. But mechanism uses continuous field - problematic.

Name: Graviton (G)
S_observable_Analysis: Not in S_observable. Gravity = geometry (GR) not particle.
Evidence: Never observed. QFT artifact. Already in ethers.csv:28.

Name: Antiparticles (all)
S_observable_Analysis: Discrete spacetime may not require full antimatter doubling?
Evidence: Observed but: does discrete theory require full doubling?

Name: Virtual Particles
Unbounded_Assumptions: Exist only in calculations; violate energy conservation
S_observable_Analysis: Not in S_observable. Perturbation theory artifact.
Evidence: Never observed directly. Already in ethers.csv:33.

Name: Color Charge (R/G/B)
S_observable_Analysis: Confinement = never observe isolated color = S_observable boundary
Evidence: Only colorless hadrons observed. Color = internal S_complete structure.

Name: Weak Isospin
S_observable_Analysis: Broken to U(1) at low energy. Continuous breaking problematic?
Evidence: Electroweak unification real but mechanism (Higgs) questionable.

Name: Hypercharge
S_observable_Analysis: Combined with isospin gives electric charge. Structure unclear.
Evidence: Why these quantum numbers? Ad hoc assignments.

Name: Three Generations
S_observable_Analysis: Generations = energy resonances. Only 1st gen stable = REAL. Others = excited.
Evidence: Biggest mystery. 3 is arbitrary. Bounded theory: resonance structure.

Name: Mass Hierarchy
S_observable_Analysis: Continuous mass parameters. Should be discrete eigenvalue spectrum.
Evidence: 19 arbitrary parameters. All should derive from bounded structure.

Name: CKM Matrix
S_observable_Analysis: Mixing = discrete sampling of mass basis. Parameters not fundamental.
Evidence: Why these values? Should derive from bounded structure.

Name: PMNS Matrix
S_observable_Analysis: Same as CKM - discrete sampling artifact
Evidence: Neutrino oscillation = sampling. Matrix = artifact.
